intro: Hybosperma spinosum, commonly known as the spiny hybosperma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and palmate leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, contributing to its dispersal in the wild.
